department: Foreign Affairs, Trade And Development (Department Of)
short_summary: The office of the Canadian Ombudsperson for Responsible Enterprise requires services of a Strategic Procurement Advisor.
description: TASK and SOLUTIONS PROFESSIONAL SERVICES (TSPS) REQUIREMENT
tags: Open only to those Supply Arrangement Holders under E60ZT-18TSPS who qualified under Tier 1 for services in the National Capital Region for the following category: One (1) 3.7 Procurement Specialist
full_summary:
Tender Title: Strategic Procurement Advisor
-
#### Contract Summary
The Department of Global Affairs Canada (GAC) invites tenders for the provision of expert services as a Strategic Procurement Advisor to support the timely and efficient implementation of procurement plans.

##### Contract Details
- **Contract Duration:** January 2023 to July 31, 2024
- **Contract Period:** 114 days
- **Procurement Method:** Selective Tendering
- **Trade Agreements:** Subject to Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, and Canadian Free Trade Agreement.
- **Security Requirement:** Common PS SRCL #6 applies with a minimum corporate security clearance of Designated Organization Screening (DOS)

#### Description of Work
The successful proponent will provide expert advice on procurement strategies, draft and review statements of work, and participate in bid evaluations to support the Canadian Ombudsperson for Responsible Enterprise (CORE) in its procurement activities.

#### Qualifications Requirements
To be considered, vendors must have an active Supply Arrangement (SA) under E60ZT-18TSPS and be qualified for Tier 1 services in the National Capital Region.

#### Contact Information
For more information, please contact Radan Vasic, Contract Authority, at radan.vasic@international.gc.ca or 613-791-7811.
- **Closing Date:** January 6, 2023 at 2:00 pm EST.

**Trade Agreements:** In order to participate in this procurement process, bidders must be able to provide services in compliance with the following trade agreements:
- Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement
- Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
- Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
- Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement
- Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
- Canadian Free Trade Agreement

Note: The trade agreements referenced above are Federal and/or Provincial level trade agreements and committee to comply with its regulations and requirements. The ministry is committed to researching alternative consumer and supplier tax implications, as assumed under the federal law amendments.
